headline: Nike Balances Japan Clean Energy Push With Costly Supply Chain Shift
summary: Nike (NYSE:NKE) has agreed to source 100% renewable energy for its operations in Japan as part of its decarbonization goals. The company is realigning its global supply chain to reduce reliance on Chinese manufacturing. These moves come as a new 15% global tariff affects Nike’s cost base and trade flows. Nike, the global athletic footwear and apparel brand, is reacting to a tougher trade backdrop while pressing ahead with its sustainability agenda. The clean energy deal in Japan and the...
